body:
Comment 2: 
Go, by design, has minimal dependence on external libraries. It is unfortunate that,
solely to run an external benchmark, a new dependency has been introduced. Is the glib
dependency really necessary?

If the glib dependency is necessary, there is a bug in Revision f33da81baac2. The
documentation for the "Install C tools, if needed", section of "Installing Go from
source" does not list libglib2.0-dev as one of the external libraries for Ubuntu/Debian.
http://tip.golang.org/doc/install/source#ctools
